clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess Safety of Nivolumab in Routine Oncology Practice in China
clinical_study.official_title: The Prospective Observational Safety Study for Nivolumab in China Routine Oncology Practice

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety of nivolumab in routine cancer practice in China. Part one of the study will investigate nivolumab for non-small cell lung cancer previously treated with platinum-based chemotherapy that has locally advanced or has spread. Part two will investigate nivolumab for post-platinum squamous cell carcinoma of head and neck that is recurrent or has spread.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of nivolumab-related immune-related adverse events (irAEs)
Incidence rate of nivolumab-related adverse events (AEs)
Incidence rate of nivolumab-related serious adverse events (SAEs)

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck

arm_group.description: Participants with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
Participants with squamous cell carcinoma of head and neck (SCCHN)

study_pop.textblock:
In part 1, the study population consists of 300 adults treated with nivolumab for the first time at public hospitals or tumor hospitals in China for second-line + non-small cell lung cancer (2L+NSCLC) approved by the NMPA over the study period 2020 to 2024.
In part 2, the study population consists of 100 adults treated with nivolumab for the first time at public general hospitals or tumor hospitals in China for post-platinum recurrent or metastatic SCCHN approved by the NMPA over the study period 2020 to 2024.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Part 1
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of advanced/metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) previously treated with chemotherapy
- Treatment with commercial nivolumab for the first time. For second-line (2L)+NSCLC, indication approved by (National Medical Products Administration) NMPA Part 2
- Histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of recurrent/metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of head and neck (SCCHN) previously treated with chemotherapy
- Treatment with commercial nivolumab for the first time. For post-platinum recurrent or metastatic SCCHN, indication approved by NMPA
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior participation in a clinical trial within the past 4 weeks
- Current or pending participation in a clinical trial
- Current or pending systemic treatment for cancer other than 2L+ NSCLC for part 1 and SCCHN for part 2
- Previously treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria apply
